intro: Darwinia macrostegia, commonly known as the large-stemmed Darwinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spikes of tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. The plant typically grows in heathlands and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It features narrow, linear leaves and can reach heights of up to 2 meters. Darwinia macrostegia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
